definitions: To alter something from its original course, meaning, or state to a distortion or corruption of what it was meant to be.
To lead someone away from what is considered right, good, or proper; to corrupt.
To misuse or misapply something, especially in a way that is considered immoral or improper.
examples: He tried to pervert the course of justice.
The cult leader sought to pervert the minds of his followers.
Some people pervert the meaning of the law for personal gain.
